Fire is the heat and light energy released during a chemical reaction, in particular a combustion reaction. Depending on the substances alight, and any impurities outside, the color of the flame and the fire's intensity might vary. This fire dances in golden yellows with bursts of reds and blues. Fire worship has roots in many religions, and is considered to be an agent of purity and as a symbol of righteousness and truth. This has been explained to be because fire burns ever-upwards and can't itself be polluted. Whatever your religion, fire is often the hearth or heart of the house, captivating and drawing us to gather. This digital fire puts no polluting emmisions into the atmosphere.
